about.name: San Diego
about.info_text: San Diego is a beautiful coastal city located in Southern California, known for its pleasant climate, stunning beaches, and a wide range of attractions. With a diverse cultural scene, vibrant neighborhoods, and a strong focus on outdoor activities, San Diego offers something for everyone. Visitors can explore historic sites, enjoy world-class dining, and experience the laid-back Southern California lifestyle that makes the city unique.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 1.4 million
State: California
Time Zone: Pacific Time Zone (UTC-08:00)
Language: English, Spanish
Currency: US Dollar (USD)
about.climate_text: San Diego has a Mediterranean climate with mild, wet winters and warm, dry summers. The city is known for its sunny days and pleasant temperatures, making it a year-round destination for outdoor enthusiasts.

attractions_card.title: Balboa Park
attractions_card.description: Balboa Park is a sprawling urban park that houses museums, gardens, and the famous San Diego Zoo. It's a cultural hub and a green oasis in the heart of the city.

attractions_card.title: La Jolla Cove
attractions_card.description: La Jolla Cove is a picturesque beach known for its crystal-clear waters, tide pools, and the opportunity to see sea lions and seals up close.

attractions_card.title: USS Midway Museum
attractions_card.description: The USS Midway Museum is located on a decommissioned aircraft carrier and offers a fascinating look at naval aviation history.

attractions_card.title: Seaport Village
attractions_card.description: Seaport Village is a waterfront shopping and dining complex with a scenic boardwalk and a variety of boutiques and restaurants.

attractions_card.alt: Old Town San Diego State Historic Park
attractions_card.title: Old Town San Diego State Historic Park
attractions_card.description: Old Town San Diego is the birthplace of California and is home to historic buildings, shops, and restaurants that offer a glimpse into the city's past.

attractions_card.title: San Diego Natural History Museum
attractions_card.description: The San Diego Natural History Museum, located in Balboa Park, features exhibits on the region's flora, fauna, and geological history.

attractions_card.title: Torrey Pines State Natural Reserve
attractions_card.description: Torrey Pines State Natural Reserve is a coastal wilderness area with hiking trails and unique, rare Torrey pine trees.

attractions_card.title: Gaslamp Quarter
attractions_card.description: The Gaslamp Quarter is San Diego's historic district, known for its nightlife, restaurants, and Victorian-era architecture.

food_card.title: Fish Tacos
food_card.description: San Diego is famous for its fish tacos, which can be found at various seafood shacks and restaurants throughout the city.

food_card.title: California Burritos
food_card.description: California burritos are a local specialty, typically filled with carne asada, french fries, cheese, and salsa.

food_card.title: Craft Beer
food_card.description: San Diego is known for its thriving craft beer scene, with numerous breweries and taprooms offering a wide range of beer styles.

food_card.title: Avocado Dishes
food_card.description: California avocados are a staple in San Diego cuisine, and you can enjoy dishes like avocado toast and guacamole.

food_card.title: Mexican Cuisine
food_card.description: San Diego's proximity to Mexico influences its food scene, with many restaurants offering authentic Mexican dishes.

hotels_card.title: Hotel del Coronado
hotels_card.description: The Hotel del Coronado is a historic beachfront resort known for its Victorian architecture and luxurious accommodations.

hotels_card.title: The Lodge at Torrey Pines
hotels_card.description: The Lodge at Torrey Pines is a luxury hotel offering a scenic golf course, spa, and comfortable, craftsman-style rooms.

hotels_card.title: Pendry San Diego
hotels_card.description: Pendry San Diego is a trendy boutique hotel located in the Gaslamp Quarter, featuring stylish rooms and several dining options.

hotels_card.title: Manchester Grand Hyatt San Diego
hotels_card.description: The Manchester Grand Hyatt offers stunning bayfront views and numerous amenities, including rooftop pools and restaurants.

hotels_card.title: Kimpton Hotel Palomar San Diego
hotels_card.description: The Kimpton Hotel Palomar is a chic, boutique hotel with modern design and a rooftop pool in downtown San Diego.

transport_card.title: San Diego Trolley
transport_card.description: The San Diego Trolley is a light rail system that connects various parts of the city, including downtown and the U.S.-Mexico border.

transport_card.title: Bus Services
transport_card.description: The Metropolitan Transit System (MTS) operates bus services throughout San Diego, providing access to different neighborhoods.

transport_card.title: San Diego International Airport
transport_card.description: San Diego International Airport (SAN) is the city's main airport, serving domestic and international flights.

transport_card.title: Ride-Sharing Services
transport_card.description: Ride-sharing services like Uber and Lyft are readily available in San Diego for convenient transportation.
